com.rivescript

Class TopicManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rivescript.TopicManager

  • public class TopicManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A topic manager class for RiveScript.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TopicManager

        public TopicManager()
        Create a topic manager. Only one per RiveScript interpreter needed.

    • Method Detail

      • topic

        public Topic topic(java.lang.String topic)
        Specify which topic any following operations will operate under.
        Parameters:
        topic - Name of the topic (will be constructed if it doesn't exist).

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String topic)
        Test whether a topic exists.
        Parameters:
        topic - Name of the topic to test.

      • listTopics

        public java.lang.String[] listTopics()
        Retrieve a list of the existing topics.

      • sortReplies

        public void sortReplies()
        Sort the replies in all the topics. This will build trigger lists of the topics (taking into account topic inheritence/includes) and sending the final trigger list into each topic's individual sortTriggers() method.

      • findTriggerByInheritance

        public Trigger findTriggerByInheritance(java.lang.String topic,
                               java.lang.String pattern,
                               int depth)
        Walk the inherit/include trees starting with one topic and find the trigger object that corresponds to the search trigger. Or rather, if you have a trigger that was part of a topic's sort list, but that topic itself doesn't manage that trigger, this function will search the tree to find the topic that does, and return its Trigger object.
        Parameters:
        topic - The name of the topic to start at.
        pattern - The trigger pattern text.
        depth - The current depth limit (should start at 0), for recursion.

      • getTopicTree

        public java.lang.String[] getTopicTree(java.lang.String topic,
                              int depth)
        Walk the inherit/include trees starting with one topic and list every topic we find.
        Parameters:
        topic - The name of the topic to start at.
        depth - The current depth limit (should start at 0), for recursion.
